thread.title: Small 3.2 magnitude quake shakes South West | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: Small 3.2 magnitude quake shakes South West | DailyTelegraph

author: dailytelegraph.com
title: Small 3.2 magnitude quake shakes South West | DailyTelegraph
text:
A MAGNITUDE 3.2 earthquake has struck near the West Australian town of Harvey overnight, shaking houses and waking locals. According to Geoscience Australia , the quake struck at 12.40am at a depth of 10km and could have been felt by people up to 28km away.
Former Channel Nine newsreader Sonia Bennett (formerly Vinci), who now lives on a farm in Harvey, in the state’s southwest, told 6PR she and her husband woke at 12.40am to what she thought was “a massive explosion.’’
Other Stories ‘My husband and I haven’t had sex in a year’ Relationships Greek model saves drowning refugee World 0 comments Take his name and you’ll be called ‘actor’s wife’ Rendezview 0 comments Fleeced! The woolly world record holder Nsw 0 comments Podcast: How Justin Bieber told Alli he had a crush on her Sydney Confidential 0 comments Ultimate sex guide for men, by women Relationships “The earth shook for about 20 seconds,’’ she said.
“We raced outside to see if there was any smoke haze or glow on the horizon to suggest there was an explosion.
“My initial reaction was thunder, then I thought explosion and then maybe a meteorite.
“But then this morning when I heard it was an earthquake, I realised that’s what it was.
“It sounded like an explosion, it was enough to shake us out of bed.’’
Sonia Bennett, nee Vinci back in 2005 during her days with Channel Nine. Picture: Jackson Flindell Harvey resident Georgia Larsen said she felt the ground shake as she lay in bed.
“I was woken up by the rumble. I actually thought it was thunder,” Ms Larsen said.
“I could feel the rumble that came with it, that shook the ground, so it did actually scare me because I wasn’t sure what it was and I never thought it would be an earthquake in Harvey.”
Collie Shire President Wayne Sanford said he was woken in the middle of the night when he heard “strange rumbling sounds”.
“I just felt a bit of a rumble and one of my work colleagues said he felt the house shaking,” Mr Sanford said.
“It certainly woke me up. I heard this strange rumbling sound but it wasn’t until the news this morning that I realised what it was.”
Other residents took to social media to share their experience.
“I was awake reading — the birds and dogs went wild. It was like an explosion. Noise first then everything shook here in Harvey,” one woman said.
So far, there have been no reports of damage.
Sammy Brockliss: I’m in dawesville, didn't feel anything but heard a rumbling noise that I thought was thunder roughly about half past 12, it was very loud.
Carol Carlisle : “Yep thought my roof was going to come off — house shaking was very eerie in Harvey.’’
Helen Pinner: “ I felt it thought my house was going to collapse pretty scary, it only lasted about 10 seconds.’’
Anthony Milici: “ Yeah woke me up weird feeling the earth kind of swirls a bit sounds like rolling thunder. Not far from our house.’’
Small magnitude 3.2 earthquake felt near Harvey in WA's South West. Picture: Geoscience Australia Originally published as WA quake: ’It was like an explosion’
